Although SARS-CoV-2 preferentially infects the lungs and respiratory tract like other respiratory viruses, COVID-19 can cause a diverse range of extrapulmonary manifestations including CVD, stroke, seizures, liver damage, renal dysfunction and gastrointestinal symptoms
117 . Systemic hyperinflammation induced by viral pneumonia is likely to have an important role in the development of these varied manifestations of COVID-19, but numerous studies have also reported histological evidence of direct viral infection in non-respiratory organs such as the heart, brain, liver and kidney
59, 69, 118 .
